Libby dropped by that afternoon. Thankfully, she didn't bring any food with her this time. Also, while she came to see me, she was utterly fascinated by Grace. She was at that age when the idea of growing another person inside your body was totally magical, and Grace being miniature made it that much more amazing.

For her part, Grace was super, super patient with Libby, answering every question she had, and keeping it at Libby's level. You could tell she was going to be an amazing mother.

"Hey, Libby," I called to her, letting Grace get back to her life.

"Staci, Grace is gonna have a baby soon."

"I heard. Isn't that special? But how are you doing?"

"I miss having you around, Staci. And Carrie misses you, too." Carrie Matheson was Libby's babysitter. Before I moved for the show, she also made sure I was doing alright.

"Well, I think I can get away this weekend. Maybe we can play together then?"

"Yay!!!"

******************************


That night, Jesse came by my house. "So," he said, "I've been thinking about our talk."

"I have, too," I said. "I think I've found a compromise."

"What is it?"

"Come inside, and we'll talk."

Jesse liked the sound of that. He was happier when I brought him upstairs to discuss my compromise, and happier still when we reached an agreement.
111111111111111311111111121111131111111.title: Later On

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The one downside to our impromptu compromise was that Jesse was stuck with wearing yesterday's clothes the next morning. But, on the bright side, everyone else in the village already knew about our disagreement, so they would be happy we were on our way back to being a couple.

Jesse and I were exchanging goodbye kisses on the porch, when a voice said, "I'd heard you two were on the rocks. Glad to see you're working things out."

We were more than a little embarrassed. "Good morning, Mr. Grey," I said.

He hunkered down. "I came because I have something important to discuss with you. May we speak privately?"

It was highly irregular for Mr. Grey to actually want something not commemorated on camera, so we had to know what was up. We agreed, and Mr. Grey carried us to the kitchen.

After he set us on the counter, he asked, "Do you remember Hannah Rose?"

"She was one of the campers, wasn't she?" Jesse asked.

"That's correct. Her folks passed away last night. It was a car accident"

"We're sorry to hear that."

Mr. Grey nodded. "Her grandparents are good people, but they say they can't care for a girl so small. This is where you come in."

"What could we do?" Jesse asked, though I had my suspicions.

"The two of you are the closest thing we have to a married couple. I guess what I'm asking is... would you be willing to adopt her?"
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: A Major Step

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Jesse and I turned to each other, surprised. "We can't leave the kid in the hands of the state." Wincing, I said. "Who knows what would happen to her?"

"That, and she's likely already scared out of her mind." Wincing as well, Jesse added. He turned to Mr. Grey. "Are there no other families of the shrunken kids who will take her in?"

Mr. Grey shook his head. "We already asked, they all turned her down, as they already have their hands full with a shrunken kid of their own." Calmly, he said. He then smiled. "Still, I get the feeling you two won't turn her away..."

"Being turned away by the others is just too cruel." Serious, I said. "We will gladly take her in and go from there."

"Adopting her right off the bat would not be right." Firmly, Jesse said. "We will take care of her, and talk about adoption after she has had some time to grieve."

"You're good people." Smiling, Mr Grey said. "We'll make a special out of it, so the world can see you are just like regular people, just smaller."

"Keep the kid out of it," firmly, I demanded. "The last thing she needs right now is a giant camera shoved in her face."

"I understand." Calmly, Mr Grey said. "The girl's name is Hannah Rose. Shall I bring her in?"

Jesse and I nodded, and Mr. Grey walked off. Mrs Grey came in shortly after, carrying a tiny little girl, crying on her knees, in the palm of her hand. Hannah was petite, with long blond hair, blue eyes and doll-like features. "Hannah, this is Staci and Jesse." Gently, Mrs Grey said. "They have agreed to take care of you."

Mrs Grey then gently placed Hannah onto the fake grass in front of us, where she slowly looked up, with tears in her eyes. "I-I remember you." Crying, she said. "No-No one else wants me..."

She began to cry uncontrollably, to which I gently took her into my arms with a warm hug, slowly rocking her back and forth to comfort her. Jesse joined the hug with cameras catching the precious moment. "Congratulations, kids," softly, Mrs Grey said. "You have officially become the guardians of an orphaned child."

Jesse and I smiled at each other. "I guess that means you'll have to move in with me." Softly, I said. I then smiled. "You're still getting a separate bedroom for now."

Jesse chuckled at that. "Of course..."

A series of yips interrupted us, and we looked down to see the tiny timber wolf pup from before, wagging its tail happily at us. Hannah grinned, though still crying. "Fozzie!"

Mr Grey chuckled. "The kids proved to be just as indestructible as you, so we saw no harm in allowing Hannah to keep a pet."

Jesse sighed, though smiling. "What a week." Bemused, he said. "We have our first fight, and come out of it with a daughter and a pet timber wolf."

I giggled at that, and we both kissed Hannah on one cheek, before putting her down to greet her wolf pup. A new chapter in our adventures had begun.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Continue

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
My Victorian manor had three bedrooms besides mine. I had planned to use one as an office for taking classes, which still left one each for Jesse and Hannah.

Jesse enlisted the help of Dave and Tommy, and a crew member graciously offered to carry Jesse's things from his old house to mine. I directed traffic during the move, and fed the boys when their job was done, then I helped Jesse unpack. That went slower than the packing probably did, because we naughty two kept smooching instead of working. I'm sure more than one viewer at home must have wondered why we were acting like he wasn't going to be sleeping in my bed.

Once that was done, the four of us went to the market to buy some things for our new family members. Hannah was tickled pink to see that we had cereal boxes in our size. I didn't understand the process, I just bought what was available. We had to get creative finding things for Fozzie, because there were no other pets in the village.

Once we were all settled in, I called Dad and Allie, to let them know there would be more than just me staying in the living room. Dad was surprised that the word adoption was already being bandied about, but he and Allie were sure there was room for everyone, and figured Libby would love to have a playmate, even one who was smaller than she was.

That night, I didn't sleep alone, but not in the way that Jesse would have preferred. Hannah wanted to share my bed, and she wanted Fozzie to sleep with her. Hope she doesn't need this when she has a full-grown wolf, I thought, as I turned out the light.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Jesse moves in with me.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Allie welcomed Hannah with the closest thing to a hug a big person can give someone our size: she held the little girl to her chest. Dad did the same with me. Clearly, Hannah missed having that contact with a big person, because she clung to Allie's blouse when it was over.

Libby welcomed us all, then turned to me and asked, "Did Grace come with you?"

"No, honey," I replied. "Grace doesn't want to be too far from home right now. I think she calls it nesting."

Libby nodded, satisfied with learning one more thing about pregnancy. Turning to Hannah, she asked, "Wanna see my dollhouse?"

"Okay!" Hannah replied.

Meanwhile, Dad was fascinated by Fozzie. "They actually let an 8-year-old keep a wolf cub?"

"Fozzie can't harm her," Jesse explained, "and she needs tender loving care. They figured it would be like when our ancestors turned wolves into dogs."

The whole time, Dad was amusing himself by letting Fozzie fight his little finger.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Visiting Dad and Allie

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
When we came back to the village, we gathered everyone from the camp into the park for a meeting. "As you know," I said, "Hannah is staying with us now, and we... well, we've come up with an idea that may help her, and also any of you who are having trouble adjusting to our 'new normal.'"

"What's the idea?" asked Christy, one of the counselors.

"We're hosting a slumber party up at the house," Jesse replied. "A few of the other kids from the camp will be there. There will be games, music, food. Basically, it's a night to think about anything except height."

"I don't know," said Trevor, a counselor who I'd seen hanging out with Christy. "I get gawked at enough."

"There will be no gawking," I said. "We'll cover all the cameras in the house, so it's completely private."

That brought more people around to the idea. It looked like the reality show was starting to slip in popularity. At least, that's how it was among folks in the village.

"As long as we're covering cameras," Jesse asked, after the meeting broke up, "how about we talk about a little private time for us?"

"I think we can work something out," I said, a euphemism that had replaced compromise as a way to discuss sex that didn't involve inserting Tab A into Slot B, if you know what I mean.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Slumber Party Idea

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
"Thank you, Staci," Grace said for the umpteenth time. "I think we all needed this."

Within half an hour of the first guests arriving, people were acting like they were friends who enjoyed hanging out together. "I'll repeat your words to my stepmother," I replied, "it was her idea."

Truth be told, I hadn't shared Allie's confidence in the slumber party idea, and had even argued against it. "Everything is a reminder," I said. "These people only expected to be together for a few weeks. There's only one reason they continue to see each other every day, and it's because they've shrunk."

"It's not about that," Allie countered. "They're used to having things to break up the routine: sports, going to the movies, doing something fun with the kids. They aren't chafing at each other, they're chafing at the rut they're in. Give them something to do, and watch them take off with it."

I made a mental note to tell Allie the next time I saw her. I was glad to admit I was wrong. I made another mental note to suggest Mr. Grey come up with similar ideas. Some, they might not mind being filmed for.

******************************


I had thought that at least some of the guests would want to head home at the end of the evening, but I was glad to see they all decided to stay the night. Jesse and I did a final check before turning in. The living room floor was full of sleeping adults and children.

Upstairs, I checked in on Hannah, and found her sharing her bed with Grace. "They look nice together, don't they?" Jesse whispered in my ear.

"That they do," I whispered back. "I thought you were going to bed."

"So did I, but Trevor and Christy beat me to it. Three guesses what they did."

I groaned. "If this were a horror movie, they'd be dead now. Well, come on, we have to come up with some sort of arrangement."

A mutually appealing arrangement, might I add.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Slumber Party

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
As we waved goodbye to our departing guests, we received a visit from both Mr. and Mrs. Grey. "How did the party go, Staci?" Mr. Grey asked.

"It went fine," I replied. "I think there should be events here in the village, to break up the dull routine."

"There's nothing wrong with maintaining a routine," he said. "A routine can prevent terrible accidents."

"It's not that kind of routine, Anthony," Mrs. Grey said. "They haven't heard, they don't know."

"What don't we know?" Jesse asked.

Mr. Grey sighed. "I suppose I should tell you. No doubt you've been wondering about parts of it." He took a breath. "We have developed a shrink ray."

"A shrink ray?" I couldn't believe my ears. "How? Why?"

"We developed it from meteorite fragments," he explained. "It's how we've miniaturized foodstuffs for the market."

"And what happened?" Jesse asked.

"The worst possible thing. My niece, Holly, came by the facility. She found an unlocked door that should have been locked, and hid in the one room that should have been checked thoroughly."

"The room with the shrink ray," I whispered.

Mr. Grey nodded. "She wasn't hit directly, but she received environmental exposure." He struggled to keep his composure. "It was never meant for use on human or animal subjects. We have no idea what will happen to her."

"I'm so sorry for you guys," I said. "Give Holly my number, so we can talk."

******************************


Holly called me that night. "I guess Uncle Tony told you about me," she said.

"He's worried about you," I replied. "How are you?"

"Three inches shorter. I'm scared." She wiped at her eyes. "They say the ray is different from what you all got, so there's no telling what will happen to me. I could be smaller than you, I could wind up microscopic, I could... " She broke down and cried.

"We'll all do everything we can for you," I told her. "Everyone in the village knows how it feels to be smaller than everyone. If necessary, we'll take care of you."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Familiar Faces

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
It didn't take long for word to spread and rumors to start. To put a stop to those rumors, I called a meeting in the park. "I know you've all heard about Holly, the Greys' niece," I said. "So we're all on the same page, here are the facts in her case:

"The Greys have developed a shrink ray, which they've been using to shrink groceries down to our size. Holly was looking around the facility where they do this, and managed to get into the room with the shrink ray. She was not struck by the ray, but received what they call environmental exposure. She is now shrinking at a rate of three inches per day, which is faster than my friends and I shrank, but slower than those at summer camp shrank. Because the radiation from the shrink ray is different from exposure to the meteorite, nobody knows how small she'll become. She might stop shrinking tomorrow, she might shrink to our size, or she might just keep shrinking until there isn't enough of her left to shrink."

I took a breath. "She knows all about this, and she's distraught. In fact, I'd go so far as to say she's scared shitless. So, if and when she comes to us, let's all take care of her the way we would want if it happened to us."

They didn't let me down. The next day, when Mrs. Grey brought Holly around, she received a warm welcome from her new friends in the village.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Village Reacts

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
On the next visit my miniature family and I took to Dad and Allie's, we were still standing on the dining room table when there came a knock on the door. Dad opened it, to reveal Holly, accompanied by Mr. Grey. They had apparently talked before coming by, because Dad simply welcomed her and took her suitcase into my old bedroom.

I followed, carried by Allie. "What do you think?" I asked.

"It looks nice," she replied. "What are the carpeted steps for?"

"According to the manufacturer," I answered, "they're for dogs who have trouble climbing into their masters' beds. In this apartment, this past spring, they were for a 17-year-old girl who had shrunk too small to climb into bed any other way."

Holly looked at Dad. "You guys thought of everything, didn't you?"

"Allie's the fast thinker," Dad replied. "When we had time to plan, that's where I came through. How are you doing?"

"I've shrunk a foot and a half from stupidity. Other than that, I'm good."

I signaled for Allie to put me down where Holly could reach me, then they left us alone. "What's going on, Holly? You can tell me."

"What's it like, shrinking when you know where it'll stop?"

I shook my head. "I couldn't tell you. We were the first people to shrink, so we had no clue when, or even if, we would stop. As far as we knew, we might dwindle away to nothing. We just didn't let on to anyone except each other. We all celebrated when we stopped, because it wasn't a sure thing. Dad and Allie, in my case, wouldn't even let me hint at the prospect."

"My folks are like that."

"Tell you what: You call me when you want to talk about the stuff your folks don't want to talk about. I've been in that hole, so I'd like to help you out."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Holly Visits Dad and Allie

choices: The cameraman is angry he got fired.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Unknown to me until I returned, Quinn got her first patient as a veterinary student. Fozzie, the shrunken timber wolf, was injured, after protecting the village from a real threat.

One of the cameramen had opened one of the apartment windows in order to smoke. That alone was forbidden, but what made it worse was that he neglected to close it. A house sparrow, 6.3 inches long, flew in and spotted the village. Normally, a house sparrow is a compact bird with a full chest and a large, rounded head. But, to the villagers, it was a monster that stood just as high as we did. It let out a chirp that sounded more like a screech to us and tried to peck at us.

"How did that get in here!?" Fearful, Taylor demanded.

Tommy pointed to a window, to our perspective, miles away. "Some idiot opened a window!"

He was about to strike the bird with his guitar like a club, until he became pinned down by the bird's talons. It was clear that the sparrow saw Tommy as a meal...

That was when Fozzie jumped in, yipping and growling at the bird with all of its tiny might. The sparrow did not know how to react to it and jumped back, releasing its intended prey. Still, it gave Fozzie a strong swipe of its talons. Fozzie let out a loud yelp, but he was not done. He bit the sparrow's leg and held onto it as the bird screeched in pain.

"Everyone, move!" urgently, Quinn screamed.

The others turned, then dived aside, as Quinn drove the car full speed into the sparrow, throwing it off balance. It fell from the table with the car going down with it. Fortunately, Quinn was able to jump out in time, and Fozzie let go as the sparrow fell. The bird hit the floor with a satisfying crunch with the tiny car landing on top of it. The bird was not killed but stunned enough not to want to fly back up. It instead retreated out the same window it came from.

"Is everyone okay?" Worried, Quinn asked.

"I'll live, but Fozzie is hurt." Grunting, Tommy said.

Quinn rushed over to Fozzie to find that his side took a bad hit from the bird's talon. "This is not good..." Tearfully, she said. "I don't know enough to fix this."

"Stay calm, Quinn." Firmly, Grace said. "I'll walk you through it."

Quinn turned to Grace, surprised. "You're a veterinarian too?"

"It was my minor in college." Shrugging, Grace replied. "You first need to get a towel over Fozzie's eyes, so he won't struggle too much while we tend to him..."

Minutes later, Mr. Grey walked in and saw the open window. He turned to the table and found the crashed car along with feathers and blood. Fear filled his expression as he rushed to the table to find Tommy's left arm in a sling and Fozzie whimpering with his entire midsection covered in bandages. "What happened here?!"

"Some idiot left a window open, and a bird flew in!" Angry, Quinn yelled. "If it were not for Fozzie, we could have all become its lunch!"

Mr Grey closed the window immediately and turned to the cameramen. "When I find out who opened that window, he is fired!" Furious, he said. "I am ordering screens and locks so this will not happen again!" He then turned to the villagers, his eyes begging. "I am asking you not to sue me over this, and to consider staying on..."

"Just don't show the footage to the camp kids." Serious, Tommy said. "They're scared shitless as it is, they don't need to have this giving them nightmares."

Mr Grey nodded. "I agree." he paused, his expression showing worry. "Anything else?"
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Fozzie, the village hero.

choices: Skip to first day of college.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
When my family and I returned from visiting my parents, we were all surprised to find Tommy in a sling and Fozzie bandaged up. He was still whimpering but wagging his tail, happy to see Hannah, Jesse, and me. "What happened?!" Concerned, I demanded.

"Some moron left the window open, and it did not have a screen." Serious, Grace explained. "A house sparrow flew in and found the village."

"But... I thought we were indestructible." confused, I said.

"We still feel pain." Serious, Tommy replied. "The bird's talons left my arm a little sore, so I'm wearing a sling as a precaution."

"What about Fozzie?" Worried, Hannah demanded. "Is he going to be okay?"

"Fozzie is fine, just a little scared." Calmly, Grace said. "At first, we thought he had a big gash from the bird's talons, but it turned out to be an old wound that healed badly. The blood we saw was from the bird, not him."

"Why is he bandaged up, then?" Curious, I asked.

"Practice." Sighing, Quinn replied. "I have to learn somehow, and Fozzie is the only animal in the village." She smiled slightly. "Fozzie does not like them, which is why he's whimpering, but, like Tommy, they are staying on as a precaution."

"You are impervious to harm but you still feel pain." Serious, Grace said. "That said, you are not invulnerable... a strong enough strike could injure you, and I, for one, do not intend to test that."

We all nodded in agreement, but I was still worried. "Has Mr. Grey at least ordered in stronger safety measures?"

Taylor nodded. "He has already installed screens and added locks to the windows, to prevent anything like this from happening again." Calmly, she said. She then smiled. "We also got a theater and a college campus, to entice us not to sue, and to stay on the program."

"The cameraman who left the window open has been fired." Serious, Tommy added. "That, and the camp kids will never see the footage of the bird's visit."

I nodded, satisfied. "So, what's playing at the theater?"

Dave rolled his eyes. "A Second Chance," Frowning, he replied. "It's a chick flick about a teenage boy who becomes a girl, due to some untested procedure to enable him to walk again."

"That actually sounds interesting." Bemused, Jesse said. "For all we knew, that meteorite could have changed all us boys into girls."

Quinn, Taylor, and I giggled at that. "Maybe we'll give you guys a makeover later." Teasing, I said. "I bet we could make you boys look fabulous."

Jesse, Dave, and Tommy all chuckled, though nervously, before Dave nudged Jesse. "Don't give them any ideas..."

I smiled, shaking my head then asked, "When do we start college?"

"Next week." Smiling, Grace replied. "It turns out that the counselors and I have the degrees to teach all of you in your chosen trades, so we all now have jobs."

I nodded, then turned to Tommy. "How long are you going to wear that?"

Tommy sighed. "Until Doctor Quinn says I can take it off."

Quinn grinned at that. "He can take it off when he can lift his arm without saying 'ow'."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Aftermath.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The theater was a reasonably good mockup of an old-time movie house, with LED lights all over the marquee. Printed posters indicated that the theater would show action movies, comedies, and other genres down the road. None of the movies were in current release, but nobody cared.

Popcorn and sodas were available at the concession stand. They were store-bought and shrunken, rather than fresh-made, but they were still a treat.

The movie screen proved to be a monitor, so we all knew that we'd be watching digital releases. Better than nothing, and real movie screens were too big for us to watch, anyway.

The first trailer was well-received. It was for a movie about a teenage girl who found herself pregnant, even though she was a virgin. I think we all wanted to see that movie.

The next trailer didn't go over so well. It was about a high school senior who was bummed because she was only five feet tall, but then she starts to grow. I guess the guys in the control room noticed it wasn't getting a positive reaction, because it got taken off the screen before she grew to more than 7 or 8 feet tall. I don't know if she got bigger than that.

I don't know, I kind of liked the different perspective. I mean, sure, I would have liked to be five feet tall again. But I thought I was short when I was five-eight. Would becoming a giant be worse than shrinking to doll size?

******************************


The movie was good. Everybody had a good time.

Back at home, I got a video chat with Holly. "How you doing, girlfriend?" I asked.

"I'm at the point where that inch I shrink every 8 hours is becoming noticeable," she replied. "Guess it won't be long before I pick up on the fractions, too."

"Everyone in the village is rooting for you, Holly. You know we all hope for the best."

"Or at least the least worst. But the elephant in the room ain't going nowhere. At least, if it comes to that, I'll be with all of you." She paused. "Uncle Tony is suggesting I move in with your folks until I'm your size. Would you be okay with me living in your old room?"

"Absolutely. Just don't damage the TV, okay? And don't touch anything I left on the top shelves."

We both laughed, and I knew then that I would be angry with whatever fate meant I couldn't hear her laugh again.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: To the theater.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The movie showing the next night was an action picture, about teens who developed amazing powers. It sounded like something Hannah might enjoy, so we went as a family.

Afterward, I touched bases with Grace. "How are things?" I asked.

"I'm due," she replied, "but I'm not dilated. Nurse Betty thinks it's because gravity isn't pulling the baby down as much."

"So you could go a while longer before you go into labor? Oof."

"Don't I know it. What's new with you and yours?"

"Hannah and Fozzie have been inseparable since we got back. I don't know which is more worried about the other. As for Holly, she's holding up as well as can be expected. She's going to move into my old bedroom, so she doesn't have to go as far when she reaches our size."

Grace shook her head. "It's like Mother Teresa said: 'I know God won't give me anything I can't handle; I just wish He didn't trust me so much.'"

We hugged, then returned to our homes.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: A Different Movie

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Shortly after talking with Grace, I ran into Tommy, who was all smiles. In fact, he was giggling much like a little kid, dancing around as he was walking my way. The sling was finally off his arm, but I had a feeling his euphoria went a little deeper than that. "What has you high up on cloud nine?" Curious, I asked. "Did Quinn finally agree to go out with you?"

Tommy grinned from ear to ear. "I'll be singing when that happens." Happily, he replied. "No, I just got my first record deal, from Epic Records!"

To say I was surprised would have been an understatement, but Tommy showed me the letter and I let out a short scream of excitement, happy for him as we both shared a hug. "Congratulations!" Smiling, I said. "I know how much this means to you!"

Tommy nodded, still excited. "Mr Grey videotaped me singing a few of my original songs, and sent it in on my behalf." Still smiling, he explained. "The record company loved it! So did Berklee, who called me up, offering me a full scholarship!"

"It looks like your dreams are coming true." Nodding, I said.

Tommy nodded back. "I hope all of our dreams come true."

After leaving him I saw Dave, also walking my way, with a sly grin on his face. Curious, I asked him, "What's with the Cheshire Cat grin?"

Dave chuckled. "I've found my calling in the political field." Grinning, he said. "Instead of running for president, I'm going to start a school, teaching kids politics."

"How will that change anything?" Confused, I asked.

"So far, we have not had any real presidential campaigns, just popularity contests of the millionaires club." Serious, Dave replied. "However, in today's society, one can run for president through the vastly inexpensive social media hub. By learning the ins and outs of this system, anyone born in the great USA can run for president."

I could only shake my head. "Looks like Taylor was right, the system did change you." I smiled. "I'm glad it changed you for the better. When are you starting your school?"

"Soon after I graduate from college with my degrees in business, social media and political law." Smiling, Dave said. "I'm going to be hitting the books hard."

"Good luck." Smiling, I said.

After talking with Tommy and Dave, I was in a very good mood, so when I saw Taylor walking my way with a smile on her face, I had to ask, "Having a good day?"

Taylor smiled at me, but with tears in her eyes. This made me worry, up until she responded. "I got a letter from the Institute for Culinary Education..." She began to cry happy tears. "Gordon Ramsey wants to add my recipes to his Hell's Kitchen menu!"

That was incredible news. Gordon Ramsey was one of the most famous chefs in the world. Both of us danced around, screaming and giggling at the same time. "Congratulations! I can imagine how proud this must make you feel!"

"ICE wants me on their team, the sooner the better." Smiling, she said. "They want me to start classes before Gordon Ramsey offers his own school to me." She paused. "I take it the others are getting good news, too."

"Tommy has his first album with Epic Records, and Dave is planning to open his own political sciences school, to teach middle class to poor students how to run for president on a dime."

Taylor giggled, shaking her head. "I knew the system was going to change him." She then softly added, "I'm glad it's for the better."

We both turned, hearing Quinn calling us as she ran over, with a letter in hand. "Guys, I got some great news!" Smiling, she announced.

"We've been getting good news all over the village." Grinning, I said. "What's up?"

"I got a letter from the University of Florida College of Veterinary Medicine." Smiling ear to ear, Quinn said. "They wrote telling me that I'm the perfect size to perform surgery on small animals, that would normally be a challenge for full grown veterinarians!" She giggled. "They want me in on a full scholarship, before some other college discovers my talents!"

I gave Quinn a warm hug, which she returned. "I guess that only leaves Jesse."

"What about Jesse?" Curious, Taylor asked. "What good news does he have?"

I giggled. "He's been getting letters from every college football team in the country, wanting him on their team, as he can spot mistakes the best coordinators might miss."

"That's going to be a tough decision." Shaking her head, Taylor said.

"Tell me about it." rolling my eyes, I replied. "As for me, Mrs Grey wants me to take over the business when she retires, as her daughter has no interests in dolls."

"What is she interested in?" Curious, Quinn asked.

I grinned. "She's a singer, like Tommy."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Dreams do come true.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
When Hannah and I got home, Jesse asked, "What put that smile on your face? The movie that good?"

"Movie?" I asked. "Oh. Well, Hannah loved the movie, but I'm smiling because our friends have just as much good news as we do."

"Tell me more."

"Tommy has a record deal, and a full-ride scholarship at Berklee."

"Awesome! What else?"

"Dave wants to start a school, to open the political field to people who aren't independently wealthy."

"More than one way to change the system. Who else?"

"Taylor is going to sell some of her recipes to Gordon Ramsay, and ICE offered her a full-ride before he could."

"Excellent. That leaves Quinn."

"She's the perfect size to operate on small animals, so the University of Florida College of Veterinary Medicine snapped her up."

We put Hannah to bed, and Jesse said, "Guess I'll talk to you tomorrow."

Maybe it was all the good news rattling around my head, but I wasn't in the mood to just kiss Jesse goodnight and go to bed. I pulled him close and kissed him, wrapping my arms around him.

Jesse picked up on my mood, returning my kiss and my embrace. In this position, we made our way into my bedroom.

I took off my top, and Jesse took off his shirt. More kissing followed.

My skirt. His pants. My bra and panties. His briefs.

No compromises. Just two people who love each other, making love.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Returning home.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
"I thought you were afraid of getting pregnant," Allie said to me, on our next visit.

"I was," I replied. "But I guess, with our futures looking up, my fears looked so small."

"Good for you guys," Holly said. "With things going so well for you guys, I've even caught myself looking forward to moving into the village." She was down to 2'3", so that spoke to her confidence.

"And we're looking forward to having you," Jesse said.

Once we were done catching up, it was into our happy routine, with Holly playing dress-up with Libby. That might even have helped her, as it seemed to amuse her as much as it did Libby. Anything that kept her spirits up had to do her some good.

Later that night, we got a pleasant surprise, as Dad agreed to let Jesse sleep in my dollhouse. The only thing better than falling asleep with him in my arms was waking up with him there.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: At Dad and Allie's

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
I woke up the morning after our return to the village to the sound of construction equipment outside my window. Opening my eyes, I saw that Jesse was still asleep next to me. Getting out of bed, I walked over to the window to find some of the crew placing a new building near the park – the construction noises were just for us. A quick look told me the building was in fact the village’s new multi-use building – for classes and general events.

Walking over to the bed, I pulled the covers off Jesse and said, “Wake up, sleepy head, we’ve got classes today.”

“Ugh.” Groaning, Jesse said, “Do I have to?”

“Yes, dummy, just because we're 6 inches tall doesn't mean we don't have classes.”

*************************


I walked downstairs a short time later, to find Hannah feeding Fozzie scraps from her breakfast. I’d tried to stop her but there was no point – Hannah was stubborn like that. As I walked past them, I gave Hannah a kiss on her head and gave Fozzie a quick pat. I had to admit, I was surprised by how domesticated he’d become in such a short time.

Looking at me as I poured some orange juice, Hannah said, “Can we go to the pool today?”

“I wish we could, kiddo, but Jesse and I both have classes.” Seeing the dejected look on her face, I said, “But I’ll tell you what, maybe Grace would be happy to take you?”

“Okay!”

Jesse walked downstairs at the point. “Good morning, Hannah.”

“Good morning, Jesse.”

Kissing me, Jesse said, “So what’s on the schedule for today?”

“Well, I’ve got my first class in about 20 minutes.” Shrugging, I said, “After that, I’m meeting with Grace and her wife to plan a baby shower.”

“Sounds like fun.”
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Campus Life in the Village

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
My class was much like how I pictured the curriculum at FIT, except that I was the only student. At least I was assured that my classes were the same ones my full-size classmates were taking. I made a note to email Morgan and the rest of my friends who were going to FIT, see if we could simulate hanging out together, minus the pizza delivery and doobage.

Once my first class was complete, I emailed my first project to Mrs. Grey, and it was off to meet with Grace and her wife. "Sorry I'm late," Grace said as she joined us. "You'd think Hannah had never seen a pool before."

"What I think," I said, "is that Hannah likes you. Let's face it, compared to Jesse and me, you're the most maternal person she's had contact with."

"Excuse me," said the big woman, "would someone correct my disadvantage?"

"Oh, sorry, honey," Grace said. "Staci, this is my wife, Lorena DeGroff. Lorena, this is my good friend, Staci Parks."

"Pleased to meet you," I said, offering her my hand.

Lorena was getting used to being courteous to the proportionally disadvantaged, as she extended her little finger and placed it in my hand. "Likewise," she said.

I said, "I think this is the first time that the mother-to-be was involved in the planning of her shower."

"Just eliminating the middleman," Grace explained. "With a village this size, I'd know all the details anyway, even without the camera crew gossiping."

There wasn't a lot of ground to cover, as most of the equipment for baby shower games isn't made in our size, and the shrink ray doesn't work on inorganic material. However, we came up with some games that everybody could enjoy, since Grace wanted it to be an all-ages party.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Baby Shower Planning

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The week went by, and the agreed-upon time came. I turned on Skype and called the number.

My call was answered immediately. "Staci!" Morgan Detweiler called. "Glad you made it, girlfriend!"

"Hey," I replied, "would I let a little thing like being a little thing keep me out of FIT? Seriously, Morgan, great to see you again. You're looking good."

"Back at you, Staci. Hey, this is my roommate, Lynne Edelman. Lynne, I want you to meet the one and only Staci Parks."

"Hi, Lynne."

"You... you're the Staci Parks?"

"I better be, or her boyfriend's got some explaining to do. What have you been up to, Morgan?"

"Oh, the usual, breaking the hearts of others. What's going on with you?"

"Well, there's the show. I'm going to be working for Grey Line, as a designer. Jesse and I hit a dry patch, but we're back at it. And we've got custody of a beautiful little girl."

Morgan was stunned by that part. "You... you're a mom?"

"You know, you're the first person to use that word, but I guess it fits. I'm a mom."

"Wow," Lynne said. "Morgan said she knew you, but I figured she was just making it up. You're really the girl who shrank, right?"

"Right or wrong, I shrank either way," I answered. Where was this going?

"Look at you, Staci," Morgan said. "A job, and a kid. I never thought it would happen."

"What do you mean, Morg?"

"I didn't mean anything by it, Staci, it's just... " She gestured at me.

"You thought, because I was small, I'd just sit there in a dollhouse. Is that what you're saying?"

"Well," she said, "when you put it that way,... "

"And what way would you put it?"

Morgan was quiet for a long time. "Maybe this was a bad idea."

"Yeah, maybe." And maybe the Titanic stopped for ice. "Goodbye."

After I hung up, I sat there, thinking. How was it that I had never seen that side of Morgan?
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Hanging Out Online

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
That weekend, we didn't go to Dad and Allie's, they came to us. We showed them around, telling them about all the features that had been put up since filming began. "At this rate," Dad said, "you'll have to stop calling this a village soon."

Of course, there was a reason Dad and Allie were there: Holly was down to 6 inches tall, and it was time for her to come to the village. "How are you doing, Holly?"

"Trying to keep looking up," she said. "Fractions of an inch are getting noticeable."

"We'll take care of you, Holly" Jesse said. "Hannah and Fozzie love making new playmates."

Before long, Holly was rolling on the artificial grass, giggling, as Fozzie played with her.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Holly Comes to the Village

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
We had a full day of amusements. I pulled up some games on my phone, and we played for hours.

After a few of those hours, I noticed that Holly had stopped shrinking. She looked to be about five and a half inches tall. I was glad that she was going to be just fine. "Hey, Holly," I said, "let's go see what's playing at the theater."

"Okay," she replied. "Anything to take my mind off of getting smaller."

"Holly, how tall were you? Before you started shrinking."

"Five-six."

"I was five-eight." I walked up next to her. "How tall would you say you are now?"

"Well, it looks like half a day, so I should be... " She looked at me next to her, and it clicked into place. "I've stopped shrinking!"

"That's right. Congratulations, Holly, and welcome to the village. If you'd like to live here, that is."

"Hey, I'm glad to be living anywhere. But yes, I think I'd like it here."

"Okay, let's go see a movie. Tomorrow, we'll see what kind of place suits your fancy."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Holly Stops Shrinking at 5 1/2 Inches

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Holly picked out a condo, and half the village helped her get settled in. "Do you guys do this for everybody who moves in?" Holly asked.

"Hard to say," I replied, "you're the first since we started. We would've had a party to celebrate, but we've already got a baby shower tonight."

"You're welcome to come, Holly," Grace said.

"Gee, thanks, but... I don't have anything."

"We in the village wished you well while you were shrinking. Your own well-wishes will be plenty."

******************************


The shower was held in the community center, the same building where we went to college. As part of the planning committee, I may be biased, but I think it went pretty well. Nobody thought the games were too adult for the visiting camp kids, or too childish for the grownups. So, either we picked out the right games, or we seriously underestimated how bored everybody was. No prizes for guessing which side I came down on.

At the end of the party, Grace got up to speak. "I want to thank all of you," she said. "Your love and support has been a godsend to us, as we get through this. I can't wait for this baby to meet you all, and I'm not just saying that because the kid's parked on my bladder."

We all laughed.

"Great," Grace said, "now I'm peeing myself."

We looked. That wasn't pee.

"Nurse Betty?" I called.

"What?" Grace asked. "What's going on?"

Nurse Betty was by her side in a flash. "Take it easy, Grace," she said, "your water just broke."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Grace's Baby Shower

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
With that little announcement, people began to freak. It seemed to take forever, but Jesse and I finally managed to persuade people to give Grace some privacy. I mean, she said she wanted everyone to meet her baby, but that didn't mean she wanted them all to see the actual act of exiting the birth canal.

We were about to leave, too, until Nurse Betty said, "Staci, I could use a little help."

I wasn't sure what I could do, but I nodded. "Go take care of Hannah," I said to Jesse.

"Holly's got Hannah," he replied, "I'm staying here with you."

"Okay, Jesse," Nurse Betty said, "go and boil some water."

He nodded and left. "I always wondered what good boiling water was supposed to do."

"In this case," Betty said, "it gives him something to do while we deliver this baby. Now, I need you to reassure Grace."

I went to Grace's side. "Anything I can do?"

"You can kick me," she replied. "My focal point is at my big home."

"Focal point?"

"It gives me something to focus on while... " And she screamed through what I could only guess was a contraction.

When she was silent again, I said, "Tell me about your focal point."

"It's a teddy bear," she said. "I've had it since I was little. Well, since I was a kid, I mean."

That gave me an idea. After each contraction, I asked Grace to tell me more about her teddy bear, and she would tell me, right up until Nurse Betty told her to push. Then, we did it again, right up until Nurse Betty said, "This is it, Grace. One last push."

Grace pushed.

A short time later, a baby started crying.

"It's a girl," Betty said.

Once Betty had the baby wrapped up, she gave her to Grace. "She's so beautiful," Grace said, Then, to me, she said, "Thank you."

And that is how Allison Staci DeGroff entered the world. She wanted to just give the baby my name, but I persuaded her that there might be some confusion with two Stacis running around the village.

Little did I know how little danger there was of the two of us getting mixed up...
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Labor and Delivery

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The next morning, we were all awakened by screaming. As soon as Jesse and I had verified that nobody in our house was screaming, we set out to figure out where in the village it was coming from.

It was the community center.

Having narrowed that down, and now joined by the rest of the village, we began looking for who was screaming. That didn't take long, as it was Grace, still in the party room. "What is it, Grace?" I asked. "What's wrong?"

"My baby," she sobbed. "My baby... "

"Jesus," Jesse said.

I looked where he was looking, and got a shock: Baby Allison had grown an actual inch overnight.

"How did that happen?" Holly asked.

"I don't know," I replied, "but maybe we can find out." Turning my attention to the cameras, I yelled, "Hey, you guys in the control room! Call Mr. Grey! Tell him we have a situation here!"

******************************


Mr. Grey was there within the hour, fully dressed. "What's wrong?"

"Baby Allison is growing," I replied. I showed her to him. "What could cause this? Could it happen to all our babies?"

"I don't think so," Mr. Grey said. "Remember, Grace was far along when she shrank. It may be that her womb shielded her baby from the permanent effects of the meteorite. In that case, any children conceived after the parents shrank would remain at your size. It may also be that the baby offers the key to restoring at least some of you to full size."

"No!" Grace cried. "I won't let my baby be tortured, even if it means I would be full-sized again!"

"Alright," Mr. Grey said. "We will speak no more of that. We will take all steps to protect your baby as she grows. She will live a normal life."

Grace nodded, and took Baby Allison to nurse her. It was clear that Grace wouldn't be able to be a mother to her baby for much longer, as her whole breast now fit into her baby's mouth.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: A Growing Baby

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
It didn't take long for news of what was happening to Baby Allison to spread all over the village. People who had been overjoyed at the prospect of a new baby were grieving, as if the baby had been stillborn.

Nobody was sadder than Grace. "A mother is supposed to watch her baby grow and move away from her," she said. "But not like this. Not so soon." She broke down in tears.

Hannah let go of our hands and walked over to Grace, hugging her. Having lost her parents, her heart automatically went out to a woman who would soon be losing her baby.

That night, Mr. Grey came for Baby Allison. "You'll see that she's protected?" Grace asked.

"Absolutely," Mr. Grey replied. "We'll look after her. Then, when she's big enough, we'll place her with the most loving mother you could ask us to find."

Thus assured, Grace placed Baby Allison into Mr. Grey's hand.

We all gave Grace our well wishes, then headed for home.

"Hannah isn't here," Jesse realized. "Hannah?"

I put a fingertip to his mouth to silence him, then pointed at Grace. There Hannah was, walking with her. "I think, right now, they need each other."

Jesse and I needed each other, too. Not in the same way Hannah needed Grace, but I was glad to have his body next to mine that night.

******************************


A few days later, Hannah made it official: She would be living with Grace from now on.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Reactions

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
A few days later, Mrs. Grey stopped by the village. "How are you doing, Staci?" she asked. "How's motherhood going?"

"Gone," I replied. "Hannah's moved in with Grace. I think they're helping each other."

"Maybe they are," Mrs. Grey said. "I came for another reason, Staci. There's a toy convention in Las Vegas in a month's time. As a Grey Line employee, I'd like you to come with me."

"Can Jesse come?"

"I see no reason why not."

"I'll need some bags."

"Of course, we have a wide selection of luggage."

"No, no, motion sickness bags."

She smiled. "So many things I never imagined would be needed."

"Like working clocks and watches."

"Hasn't Anthony explained that? Honestly. The chief problem with shrinking timepieces is that they run faster after they've shrunk. What good is a clock that says nine o'clock comes four times a day?"

"Ah. Perhaps full-sized wristwatches could be modified into clocks?"

"It's thinking like that that makes me certain I chose wisely in naming you my successor."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Talking Business with Mrs. Grey

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Jesse and I went back to visiting our folks for the weekend, beginning with mine. "Since you're here," Allie said, "I'd like to discuss the family Christmas card."

Ever since Dad married Allie, we had taken a family portrait for our Christmas card. It was, in Allie's words, "a lovely way to show friends and family who aren't nearby how much you've grown." The you in this case being me and Libby. Of course, now that I was under 6 inches tall, that raised a few questions.

"I'm still willing to do it," I said.

"I never doubted it for a second, Staci," Allie said, "you've been a booster for the cards since we started. But now, we have the matter of pulling it off. After all, we don't want to obscure your smiling face."

That was the issue. We had always done full-body portraits. Now, though, the size difference meant nobody would be able to tell what my facial expression was.

"If we go with a whimsical idea," I said, "Grey Line has a full array of outfits I can wear. We've got everything from ugly Christmas sweaters to elf costumes."

"Maybe that's the key," Dad said. "Instead of just showing us, we show how we're dealing with the big thing that happened this year."

Eventually, it was agreed: Our Christmas card this year would be us having an Ugly Christmas Sweater party, with Jesse and me in the foreground, close enough to register our smiles, with enough scale to show we weren't hiding how much we'd shrunk (as if that were possible, given our status as reality TV stars).
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Family Christmas Card

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
I'll only say this about the flight to Vegas: Get yourself someone who will hold your hair out of your face when you're throwing up.

******************************


Our first stop was the hotel room. Mrs. Grey set down her handbag on the bed, and Jesse and I came out. "Looks like a nice place," Jesse said.

"All the comforts of home," Mrs. Grey replied. "And now, your accommodations."

She placed a gift-wrapped box on the dresser and unwrapped it. "What do you think?"

I had heard rumors about an addition to the Ultimate Dollhouse Collection, but I had expected nothing like what I was seeing now:

An Airstream trailer.

"Now you, too, can enjoy all the comforts of home away from home."

In a few minutes, we were settled into our trailer. Once that was done, we christened the bed.

******************************


The convention itself maybe wasn't everything Jesse and I were hoping for. We were curiosities to the big people. They weren't interested in anything we had to say, they just wanted to look at us.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Vegas Convention

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Shortly after getting back to the hotel room, Mrs Grey received a phone call from her husband. Being as small as we were, there was no way she could speak softly enough so that we could not hear, so she did not even try. "NASA said what?!" Startled, she demanded. "Are they certain...?" she sighed. "Okay... keep us posted as best you can... goodbye."

"It has something to do with Nymph, doesn't it?" worried, I asked.

Mrs Grey nodded. "NASA held a press conference while we were at the convention." Fear in her voice, she replied. "They managed to destroy all but four pieces of the comet. One of those four is definitely going to hit somewhere."

Jesse and I exchanged startled looks. "What of the other three?" Worried, Jesse asked. "Where is the one going to hit?"

"All they said was that they were tracking the pieces, so I have no clue." Wearily, Mrs Grey said. "My husband told me that you may get a call."

"Why me?" Surprised, I demanded.

"Because a majority of the viewers of our show see you as the leader of the village." Serious, Mrs Grey replied. "They may need you to comfort those who are shrunken next."

I let out a low sigh. "I need a drink..."

"I think we need a distraction." Serious, Jesse said. "Do you think you can get us in to see a show, or take a tour of one of the casinos?"

Mrs Grey smiled. "I think I can arrange something..."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: News of Nymph

choices: We go to see David Copperfield.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Through one of the Grey family's many contacts, Mrs Grey got Jesse and me a tour of the Lucky Horse casino in Las Vegas. There were several tables being played, including dice and Roulette. Both of us got more than a few stares from the gamblers trying their luck, as we were escorted into the security rooms of the casino. There we met the owner, Mr. Benny, who greeted us with a polite smile. "Gambling is a multi-billion dollar business." serious, he explained. "We catch dozens of cheaters and hackers trying to get rich quick every year."

"I heard gambling is addictive." Wincing, I said.

"It is." Calmly, Benny replied. "We also run a treatment center for those who get hooked. We are not in the business of robbing people of their life savings, just giving them the thrill, and sometimes the lessons, of risk taking."

Benny then showed us one of the many security screens. "Here we watch every table very carefully, as sometimes even our own employees try to cheat, as to give themselves a pay bonus, or to help a friend win a hand or two." Serious, he explained. "We are only human, and thus vulnerable to temptation, but that is why rules and laws are written."

"Speaking of rules, that guy just cheated." Blurting out, Jesse said.

Benny turned to the screen to see the man at the dice table win a large bet. "How are you certain?" Curious, he asked.

"Go back twenty frames." Serious, Jesse said. "You will see that he took the dice into his right hand, but rolled them with his left, with them far apart from each other."

Benny sighed, disappointed. "He swapped the dice, a classic move." He turned to a security officer. "Get to table seven, all of his bets are officially off." The man nodded and quickly left, as Benny then turned to Jesse. "You have a good eye for detail. If you're looking for a job,..."

Jesse smiled. "I'm the new official fair play watchdog for the NFL." Politely, he explained. "I work for the organization to catch teams in the act of foul play."

Benny smiled. "So you are the one who blew the whistle on that irate fan who was hacking the scoreboard during the championship games."

Jesse chuckled. "That was me." Smiling, he said.

Benny laughed. "You saved me a lot of money, I was betting on the winning team." he paused, then added. "You also saved me a lot of money catching that cheater. It looks like the had all the tricks to rig every table in the house."

"Just one of his many talents." Kissing him, I said.

Jesse blushed. "It's what I do..."

Benny handed Mrs Grey a number of tickets. "The least I can do is get you into the David Copperfield show at MGM Grand." Smiling, he said. "I usually only offer this to my most loyal customers, but you deserve a reward."

"Thank you." Politely, Mrs Grey said. "We'll be off now."

After leaving the casino, I turned to Mrs Grey, who was carrying us in her purse. "Why did you cut the tour short?" Curious, I asked.

"Mr Benny is a likeable fellow, but he's also an opportunist." Serious, Mrs Grey replied. "He did not bother to hide the fact he had a lot of interest in your boyfriend."

I shuddered at that. "It's a good thing he doesn't know where we live."

Mrs Grey nodded. "Benny is not the type to just take what he wants, but he can be a persistent pest when he wants something." Bemused, she said. "It's best to keep him at a distance."

Jesse and I nodded in agreement.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Touring a casino.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Mrs. Grey had barely settled into her seat when someone approached her. "Would you come with me, please?" a young woman's voice said.

"I suppose I must," Mrs. Grey replied.

Jesse and I were stunned. Had Mr. Benny pulled a fast one of his own?

Our fears were assuaged, however, when we realized we were being taken backstage. But we still didn't anticipate what came next. "How do you do, Mrs. Grey?"

"Splendid, Mr. Copperfield. Yourself?"

"I'm doing quite well, thank you. Am I wrong in believing that you didn't come alone?"

"Word travels fast."

"May I say hello?"

With that, Mrs. Grey set the purse down and invited us to come out.

When we did, we were looking directly at David Copperfield himself. "So glad you could come," he said.

"The pleasure's ours," I replied.

"Since you're here," the magician said, "can I persuade you to take part in an effect with me? It won't be too demanding, and you'll be in no danger whatsoever."

"It won't involve rapid motion, will it?" I asked. "Because, if it does, you'll be in danger of the world's smallest protein spill."

"Don't worry, you'll be fine."

The effect turned out to be the famous floating-body illusion, achieved in our cases with handkerchiefs, two pipe cleaners each, and some doll shoes.

All in all, Jesse and I had a good time at the show.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: We go to see David Copperfield.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Just as Mrs Grey had predicted, her cellphone rang once again, shortly after returning to the hotel. She answered on the third ring. "Talk to me..." softly, she said. "How bad?... I see."

She then pressed a button onto her cellphone and placed it onto the table near our trailer, where we saw Mr Grey on video phone. "I'm afraid that a piece of Nymph that had escaped destruction hit Las Vegas about a week ago." Serious, he explained. "It hit in the center of a small petting zoo, just outside the suburbs. The owner of the zoo and his girlfriend were shrunk, along with the animals."

"Why were we not notified immediately of this?" Worried, I demanded.

"The news was kept quiet to avoid a panic in one of the most densely populated areas in the U.S." Calmly, Mr. Grey replied. "I was briefed on the matter only ten minutes ago."

"Did they tell you anything about the other two pieces?" Wincing, Jesse asked.

"Not a peep." Shaking his head, Mr Grey said. "All I know is that they want me to add the entire petting zoo to the village, to keep everything under wraps."

"Who are they?" Frowning, I demanded.

"The government, of course." Serious, Mr Grey said. "It does not take a lot of imagination to turn this shrinking technology into a weapon. We use a piece of that meteorite, loaned from them, for our shrinking ray."

Jesse turned pale. "I had not thought of that..."

Mr Grey nodded. "It's best if the world believes that I'm just good at making tiny things." Serious, he said. "I am, actually, by hobby, but this is easier."

"What do you want us to do?" Sighing, I asked.

"Exactly what you had been doing." Calmly, Mr Grey replied. "The owner of the petting zoo is a Mr Nick Doe, and his girlfriend is a Miss Viva Grove. They and their zoo are being transported to the village now."

I sighed. "Quinn and Grace are going to have their hands full for a while."

"Do we need to leave for the village now?" Curious, Jesse asked.

"You are scheduled to take the flight back tomorrow." Lightly, Mr Grey said. "We will see you then. Have a safe trip."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Updates

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
After collecting her things at the airport, Mrs. Grey took us right to the village. We were welcomed back by our friends. "How was Vegas?" Taylor asked.

"There was an interesting symposium on the future of toy design," I replied. "Other than that, I thought the convention was a bust. We got to see David Copperfield, though, and he invited us to take part in his act. How about the new additions?"

"The petting zoo is all set up," Holly said. "Once the gates were opened, they said it was just like when they were full-sized."

Jesse and I went to the petting zoo. The kids loved it. There were pony rides, pot-bellied pigs, even reindeer, which would be very popular come December.

It didn't take long for us to find Nick and Viva. "Welcome to the village," I said. "How are you doing?"

"Better, now that the kids are here," Nick said. "There's nothing like the way a child's face lights up when they see an animal."

"How are you handling the shrinkage? I know what a big change that can be."

"I'd probably be freaking out," Viva said, "if it was just me. But I still have Nick, and we still have the zoo."

I nodded. How many times had I said that being with friends who were also shrinking kept me together?
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Returning to the village.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
That night, I got a Skype call. To my surprise, it was from Morgan. There seemed to be something... off about her appearance. "Hello, Morgan."

"Staci," she said, tears in her eyes, "I'm sorry for those awful things I said to you. I... I didn't know I had such an ugly side to my character."

"That makes two of us," I said.

"Please... please say that you'll forgive me. I... I don't know what I'd do if it turned out I'd destroyed our friendship."

"It's been a few weeks, Morgan. What made you take this long, hard look at yourself?"

She was silent for a long time.

Then, almost under her breath, she whispered, "It's happening."

"What's happening?"

"Last week, I... I decided to play a little hooky, and I... I went to Vegas."

"You didn't," I said. If not for the Greys, I wouldn't have had the sense of dread which I now felt.

"You know how they say, 'What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas'? Don't believe it. I saw... I saw this thing fall out of the sky." The tears really began flowing now. "I thought I had gotten away from it, but I guess I didn't do it fast enough." She wiped the tears from her eyes. "I'm shrinking."

That was why she looked off. "How much?"

She shook her head. "At least six inches. Maybe more. I'm scared to measure... What am I going to do?"

"Okay, calm down. As soon as this call is over, I'm going to call somebody. When they come for you, you will go with them. We'll take it from there."

"Then... then you forgive me?"

"We'll talk about it later."

I had never thought of myself as particularly vengeful, but I did hang up thinking that some form of justice had been dealt.

If that is the case, may I never find myself deserving of judgment.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: An Apology from Morgan

choices: Checking in with Grace and Hannah
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The next day, Mr. Grey brought Morgan to see the village for the first time. Morgan looked like a deer caught in headlights. My heart went out to her, since I knew firsthand how scary shrinking was. "How are you, Morgan?" I asked.

"She isn't saying much, I'm afraid," Mr. Grey replied. "She's shrinking at the same rate you yourself did."

"Do you need a place to stay, Morgan?"

She shook her head.

"When we came to get her," Mr. Grey said, "she asked us not to take her to your apartment. I don't know if she just doesn't want to impose on them for two months, or what."

"We had a 'get-together' on Skype a few weeks ago. She said some things then that hurt me." Turning to Morgan, I said, "I'm willing to let it go, if you are."

She said nothing.

"Last night," I continued, "I found a side of myself I didn't know about. A wrathful side. I want to defeat that side of me, Morgan. You asked me for forgiveness. It's yours."

She began to cry again. "Thank you."

"Good. Now, about where you're staying, - "

"Maybe you forgive me, Staci, but I know how close your family is, and I wouldn't count on their forgiveness."

"Alright. Come by again."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Next Day

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Later that day, after taking a jog through the park, I decided to check up on Grace and Hannah. They were living in an apartment down the road from the community center. Walking up the stairs, I knocked on the door and was greeted by Hannah. Before I could react, she jumped into my arms and gave me a big hug. “Staci!”

I barely managed to stay on my feet as I walked into the apartment, seeing Grace feeding Fozzie in the kitchen. Seeing me, she walked over and said, “Hey Staci, how’d it go with your friend?”

“I told her I forgave her for what she said; I’m just glad she’s okay.” Sighing, I put Hannah down on the ground and sat down on the couch. “How are things with you? How’s the baby?”

“I spoke with Lorena last night.” Sitting next to me, Grace said, “Allison had her first checkup yesterday; she’s now the same size as a normal newborn.”

I could tell Grace was having a tough time with the situation. Looking at her, I said, “I can’t imagine how hard this has been for you.” Pausing, I said, “You’re supposed to be bonding with your baby daughter, but how can you do that when she’s 3 times bigger than you are?”

“It’s been tough. But, honestly, having Hannah around has really helped.” Chuckling, Grace said, “She’s already calling Allison her little sister.”

Before I left for Vegas, Grace had told me that she and Lorena were looking into adopting Hannah. Looking at her, I said, “Have you made any progress on the adoption front?”

“Not yet; but Mr. Grey said he’s going to do what he can.”

“I hope it works out for you guys.”

“Thanks.” Smiling, Grace said, “For now, I’ll just have to get through each day as they come.”
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Checking in with Grace and Hannah

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Jesse was there when I got home. "How'd everything go?" he asked.

"As well as can be expected," I replied. "Morgan's okay, and Grace and Lorena are working on adopting Hannah." I snuggled into his arms. "Does the house seem... I don't know... big and empty, lately?"

"I know what you mean," he answered. "It feels like something's missing."

"Ever since Hannah left. Don't get me wrong, I think she and Grace belong together. It's just... part of me was getting used to the idea of being someone's mom."

"Do you want to... try the old-fashioned way?"

"Technically, we haven't been not trying. But I think Dad's a little old-fashioned himself."

"Then maybe there's something we can do to get him on board?"

Was I hearing right? It almost sounded as if... "What are you saying?"

"I'm saying,... " He disentangled himself from my arms, and got down on one knee.

My heart skipped a beat.

He reached into his pocket, and pulled out... a ring. "Staci Parks, will you marry me?"

"Yes," I whispered. Then, at normal volume, I said, "Yes." Then , I shouted for the world to hear: "Yes!"

He put the ring on my finger. Right away, it seemed as if that finger had been bare until that moment.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Back Home

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
We couldn't wait to share the good news will everyone we knew. Allie started crying tears of joy before I got off the phone, and Dad extended his congratulations and well wishes to us both.

I was surprised by the reaction Jesse's parents had. When we made our announcement, they said, "To be honest, son, we half-expected you to tell us you'd eloped while you were in Vegas."

******************************


The next night was our engagement party. Our relatives gathered in the apartment where the village was located. Everyone was happy for us.

Mr. Grey came, saying that my tweet announcing our engagement had broken the Internet. "Your wedding is going to be the event of the century," he predicted.

"I'm so happy for both of you," Mrs. Grey said. "I would be honored to make clothes for the wedding party."

"Allie," I said, "there should be a folder on the top shelf in my bedroom closet in the apartment. Please mail it to Mrs. Grey for me." Turning to Mrs. Grey, I explained, "For as long as I've wanted a career in fashion design, I've been designing my dream wedding gown."

"Of course," replied Mrs. Grey. "I'll do everything I can to make your dream a reality."

As the party went on, it began to become clear that there were going to be decisions to be made. Quinn and Taylor both wanted to be my maid of honor, and Libby and Hannah both wanted to be my flower girl. And, of course, there was the matter of whether to have Dad give me away. I was going to need some help.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Engagement Party

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
"I appreciate you coming to me for this, Staci," Allie said. "I promise, I'll do everything I can to make this the wedding of your dreams."

"I don't expect too much in that regard," I replied. "After all, I had those dreams when I was five feet taller. Like, if it's big enough for you, the wedding party will be too tired to stand up. But, if it's sized for us, Dad walking me down the aisle will go like 'Here Comes the Bride' - in fact, here she is now."

"Hmmm. We've got some younger siblings for your friends. How about if we have the wedding party carried on platforms? That will give your little sister something to do. For the recessional, your father can carry your platform."

"That's an idea. Which reminds me, how do I choose between Taylor and Quinn for my maid of honor? I don't want to hurt the other one."

"Well, only you can decide who your maid of honor will be. But, traditionally, the other friend's job is to plan the bachelorette party."

"You're a lifesaver, Allie."

"It's nothing. Now, looking over your notes for the music, are there any changes you'd like to make?"

"Maybe let's lose 'Because You Loved Me' for the father/daughter dance. 'Lifted me up when I couldn't reach' feels a little on the nose."

"Okay, let's revisit that when everybody's together. Don't worry, Staci, we'll have plenty of meetings to sort out the details. By the way, I did find your folder. I hope you don't mind that it's tear-stained, now."

"You liked it, huh?"

"Beautiful. Mrs. Grey really scored by snapping you up."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Allie Plans the Wedding

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
It may sound funny, but, even after Dad and Allie got married, I thought that weddings were simple, straightforward affairs. Maybe it was because I didn't go along for the hard stuff. I mean, if you asked 10-year-old me to go look at flowers, try some cooking, and sample cakes, there's no way that little girl would see it as anything other than the best day ever.

But, when it's your wedding, it suddenly becomes work. Being shrunken doesn't help matters any. All those "delicate" aromas become overpowering, and the food threatens to add centimeters to your waist.

But, Jesse and I managed to get through it, and even made our choices.

I was surprised, though, when Mr. Grey tagged along. When we picked our florist, our caterer, and our baker, he hung back for a private word with each of them. Presumably, he was making arrangements to shrink the bouquet, the food, and the wedding cake.

As we walked out of the last shop, Allie asked, "So, what did you come along for, Mr. Grey? You can't be that big a fan of fondant."

"I needed to make certain arrangements with these businesses," he replied. "However, it is true that I had another reason for joining you."

"Let's hear it," Jesse said.

"I've been talking to the network. They want to air the wedding live."

"Live?"

"There's no reason to get so excited, Staci," he said. "It's not an unusual practice, and things rarely go wrong. Just ask the royal family."

"The royal family," I replied, "doesn't count Mira among their relatives."

"Ah. Don't worry, we'll make sure that she doesn't get in."

******************************


After a day of preparing for the wedding, I could definitely use a movie to relax me. The theater cooperated by showing If They Could See Me Now, a bit of escapist fantasy about a teenage girl who turns invisible. No wedding details, no birth mothers looking to extend their time in the spotlight at your expense, just a 17-year-old learning a new way to see not being seen.

And, what the movie couldn't do to relax me, the things Jesse's body and mine could do together never failed to do.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Florists and Caterers

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The next day, Jesse, his folks, and I sat down with Dad and Allie to discuss the music. However, we were in such a good mood as we carried in my phone that Allie had to ask, "What's going on with you two? You didn't go get pregnant, did you?"

"No, we haven't," I said. "But Mrs. Grey emailed us with the perfect honeymoon spot." I pulled up the email and showed them the pictures. "It's called Madurodam, and it's in the Hague, in the Netherlands. It's a scale model of famous buildings in Holland. They say it was created by an architect who supposedly went mad. You know, he says he got married, his friends want to meet her, but he says she shrank, and doesn't want to be around big people. That sort of thing."

Mrs. Larson cocked an eyebrow. "Even if it's just a story, walking around buildings your size would certainly be nice, I'm sure."

"Okay, congratulations on picking your honeymoon spot. Now, let's figure out what music we want for the ceremony and the reception."

We were pretty much on the same page, as far as music for the ceremony was concerned. We all wanted traditional music. The most discussion was in regards to the music for the reception. We picked "Good To Be Alive (Hallelujah)" for our entrance, "Happy Together" for the cake cutting, and "In My Life" for our first dance. After some back and forth, Dad and I picked "Wind Beneath My Wings" for the father-daughter dance, while Mrs. Larson and Jesse picked "Forever Young" for their dance. "Everybody Have Fun Tonight" would announce it was time for everyone to dance, while "Stand By Me" would be the last dance.

"Alright," Allie said. "Now that I know this, I'll start interviewing ensembles for the ceremony, and DJs for the reception. Don't worry, you two, this will be - "

She was interrupted by a knock on the door, which Dad answered. "Holy Jesus."

In walked Mira. Or, rather, what was left of her. She was down to half her original height.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: It's About the Music

choices: The Best Man and the Maid of Honor
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
"Mira?" Allie couldn't believe her eyes. "What happened? You're, like, three feet tall."

"Two feet, ten inches," Mira corrected. "Thank you for the lie."

"But what happened?"

Mira sighed. "A bad decision, is what happened. My de - " And then she coughed like she didn't really need to. "A professional acquaintance of mine told me he could get me something that would take off those extra pounds and inches, and leave me looking years younger." She indicated her toddler-sized clothing. "Caveat emptor. Got to read that fine print."

"What do you need from us?" Dad asked.

"Nothing, Gavin," she replied. "I've taken quite enough."

Allie asked, "Don't you need a place to stay while you... ?"

Mira shook her head. "I've been this size for a week. I'm not going to need someone to carry me around, it looks like." She turned to me and Jesse. "I hear congratulations are in order. You'll pardon me if I decline to give you my future address, it'll save me the trouble of declining your invitation. Wherever I go, I want to be away from people. I hope you understand."

"Where are you going?"

"Away. I've had enough of the public eye for one lifetime. I'm going to find some secluded spot and live like a hermit. Good thing the internet makes ordering things so easy, I won't need to show my face. Or the rest of me.Goodbye."

With that, she left.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: What Happened to Mira

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Back in the village, Jesse and I went to talk to our friends about the decisions we had made.

I brought Taylor and Quinn aside, so they could both hear it from me first. "I'm sure you know what I want to talk about."

Quinn nodded, then took Taylor's hand and raised it in solidarity. "Friends forever."

"Alright. I went back and forth on this. Taylor, I would like for you to be my maid of honor. Quinn, I know you will throw me an absolutely kickass bachelorette party."

"I'm honored to be chosen," Taylor said.

"It's going to be a night to remember," Quinn promised.

"So," Taylor asked, "how goes the planning?"

"The easiest parts are my gown and videography. Of course, Grey Line is making my gown from my design, and the network is going to broadcast it live, so they're doubling as videographers."

"Okay. Well, you let me know when it's time to get fitted for dresses, and I'll start work on your shower."

We soon ran into the guys. "Hey, girls," Jesse said. "Dave's going to be my best man, and Tommy is in charge of the bachelor party."

"We should do it a week or two before the big day," Quinn said, "so nobody's hung over when it's time for you two to be married."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Best Man and the Maid of Honor

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
At home, I got a signal for a Skype call. It was Morgan. "How you doing, girlfriend?" she asked.

"I can't complain," I replied, keeping my left hand next to my face. "You?"
