"There will be cameras, but not for the show." Calmly, Mr. Grey said. "They will be there as a memory film for the kids' parents."

"Sounds like fun." Smiling, I said.

Jessie nodded in agreement. "We will ask the others, and see who is willing to tag along for a vacation."

"I'd appreciate that." Smiling, Mr Grey said. "Also, you got some fan mail while you were overseas."

Mr Grey gave me the shrunken envelope, and I opened it. However, upon reading the letter, I turned slightly pale.

Are you really shrunken people, or are you just pretending to be? I need to know we are not alone in this world.


I showed the letter to Jesse, who looked at the envelope. "Strange, the return address says it was sent from... "
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Back Home

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
"Another apartment?" I asked. "How?"

"In Madurodam," Jesse asked, "didn't they say there were other groups, from fragments like the ones that shrank us?"

"But how?" I asked. "Wouldn't we have found them when we were kids? I definitely don't recall any tiny people in the courtyard."

"Whatever the explanation, we aren't going to find it by standing around."

"You're right." Turning up to Mr. Grey, I said, "Let's track this letter."

******************************


The apartment in question was rented by a family called the Johnstons. Mrs. Johnston let us in, then looked quizzically at the envelope under a magnifying glass. "I never sent anything like this," she said. "But... " She put down the magnifying glass. "Tara?"

In skipped a five-year-old girl. "Yes, Mommy?"

"Tara, did you send this?"

Tara looked at the letter. "You got it!"

"Yes, we got it," I said. "Thank you. Now, how did you come to send it?"

"My friends asked me to write it and send it for them."

"Tell us about your friends."

"They're little, like you."

"Oh my goodness," Mrs. Johnston said. "I thought she was making it up, even after what happened to you kids."

"And where are your friends now?"

"They live in the basement."

"Tara, how many times have I told you to stay away from that basement?"

"That's not important," I said. "We're almost at the bottom of this mystery."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Another apartment in this building.

choices: A tour of the doll house.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
The basement of the apartment building was very clean and pleasant. Part of it was a rec room for the tenants to unwind and relax, with two pool tables, a few arcade games, and a small gym. Tara led Mr Grey, who carried us, past it all, to a small storage room in the back. "I used my allowance to rent this space." Showing some pride, she said. "Before, they were just living in a hole in the wall." She teared up. "That's no way for anyone to live."

Tara then produced a small key from a necklace she was wearing, and unlocked the door, revealing a large doll house resting upon a table, with a small color television and radio on another table to the side. "They're very shy." Softly, Tara said. She then quietly called out, "They came, just as I promised."

Mr Grey placed Jesse and me on the table near the doll house, just as a tiny face peered out of one of the plastic windows. It was a small boy, no larger than the kids from the summer camp. Shortly after, a young teenage girl around my height cautiously stepped out the front door to greet us. "This is Mr Grey, a dear friend of ours." Calmly, I said. "I'm Staci, and this is my husband, Jesse."

"I'm Sara." Softly, the girl said. "We call ourselves Nomads, as we find ourselves forced to find other safe places to live."

The small boy I saw from the window came out next. "Hi, I'm Toby." Shyly, he said. "I wrote the letter. Thank you for coming."

"It was a pleasure, Toby." Smiling, I said. "Also, I can tell you that you are not alone in the world. There are communities like yours and ours in other parts of the world, such as Madurodam in The Netherlands."

"So, we're not alone." Tearing up, Sara said.

"It's not right for them to be wandering around, looking for places to live." Sadly, Tara said. "I promised them I would find a forever home for them."

"I honestly didn't think she could pull it off." Ruefully, Sara said. "Yet, she has surprised us again and again, by coming through with her promises."

"How many of you are there?" Curious, Jesse asked.

"There are eight of us." Calmly, Sara replied. She blushed before adding, "Soon, there will be nine."

"Congratulations." Smiling, I said. "We have a village with all the comforts of home in another apartment, a few floors up. It might be more comfortable than the doll house." I paused, then turned to Tara. "No offense intended, you did a great job here."

Tara blushed, a shy smile on her face. "Thank you."

"She did far more than any of us could have ever asked for." Kindly, Sara said. "I will get the others, and we can all discuss your offer together."

"Sounds great." Smiling, I said.

"Would you like to come in?" Calmly, Sara asked. "I can offer a cup of tea."
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: The Basement

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
Their method for making tea was ingenious. They put bottled water into an earthenware kettle, then heated it by placing it on the hot water pipes. When it boiled, it was poured into a teapot that was filled with shredded leaves from a full-size tea bag. "I used to do that myself," Sara said, "but I'm a little ungainly now. Now, Toby sees to the boiling water."

There weren't a lot of the Nomads. Besides Sara and Toby, there was Sara's boyfriend, Caleb; her father, Cyrus; his mother, Lavinia; Caleb's younger sister, America; and two others, Dorcas and Elisha. Dorcas was the oldest of the Nomads, still active at 65, while Elisha was 22. He mainly tended to Dorcas when she wasn't feeling well.

"It was more than 150 years ago," Dorcas said. "Our ancestors made camp in a peaceful little valley. They were undeterred by the warnings of the local Indians, who said that a terrible curse would be on their heads if they didn't give that valley a wide berth. The next morning, they found themselves only half their former size, and still getting smaller. They asked the Indians to remove the curse, but they could only shake their heads: The curse wasn't theirs, so they were powerless to lift it. All they could do was to warn others away from the place, and hope that they would listen."

"And you've been wandering ever since," I said. "Presumably, there was a fragment of a comet, like Nymph and her sisters. One such fragment interrupted our camping trip, causing us to shrink."

"There once were a lot more of us," Sara said. "I can remember when there were 30 Nomads."

"What happened to the others?"

"Injury. Natural disasters. Being eaten."

"But we're invulnerable," Jesse said.

"I am sure you are, young man," Dorcas said. "As our ancestors were. However, this protection faded away over generations, leaving us as easily harmed as our full-size fellows. That is why Toby and Sara look for a safe place to live."

"And it's here," I said. "The village where we live is in one of the apartments above us, and we can accommodate you all."

"We may not be ready," Cyrus said. "This is the only life we've ever known. I don't know if we can change."

"You don't need to make up your minds right away," I assured him. "You can stay with us for about a week. Then, once you've seen what it's like, you can make up your minds if you want to stay with us, or go on being Nomads."

That was agreeable to them, but my thoughts went back to what Dorcas had said. Since finding out that I had become invulnerable, I had taken it for granted. Now, though, I knew that the baby inside me, and the others that would follow, would be more vulnerable. Eventually, my descendants would depend on the village, not just to feel normal, but for their very lives.
1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Meeting the others.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
After a brief deliberation, the Nomads agreed to see how it was in the village, then decide if they wanted to stay or go.

I'd say that half of them made their decision when they got to the clothing store, and traded their rags for real clothes.

Toby and America struck up fast friendships with the children. Many of the adults wanted to hear Dorcas's stories about her ancestors, and their life wandering from place to place. Everyone enjoyed Fozzie and the petting zoo. And they absolutely marveled at the technology at our disposal. They sat mesmerized as I showed them our wedding video, and they oohed and ahhed over my ultrasound. "Can I have that?" Sara asked.

"I don't see why not," I replied. "The only thing is, you need a full bladder to get the best picture, so you can't tinkle on the day you go in."

Sara groaned, then said, "I suppose, if I must, I must."

******************************


Sara, Caleb, and I were at the clinic the next morning. "Your health looks good," Nurse Becky said. "Particularly for a teen mother. Now, let's take care of the reason you wanted to come in."

Nurse Becky brought in the ultrasound machine, and Sara almost jumped when the cold gel was applied. "We'll start by listening for the fetal heartbeat," Becky said. She listened with her stethoscope, nodded, and put it on for us to hear.

There are few things that are as magical for a pregnant woman to hear as the sound of her baby's heartbeat inside her. If we had stopped there, Sara would have been deliriously happy.

To me, on the other hand, the heartbeat sounded strange, as if there were an echo. But I didn't want to scare Sara, so I said nothing.

"And now," Nurse Becky said, "let's see what's going on inside you." She flipped on the machine, and a picture of Sara's baby appeared on the screen. "Here, we see the head," she explained, "the arms, and the legs."

"It's beautiful, Nurse," Sara said. "Thank you."

"There's something else I want to show you," Nurse Becky said. She moved the wand a little. "Here's the other one."

Sara's jaw dropped as she saw it.

This was why I thought I had heard an echo. It was the second baby's heartbeat.

It took Sara a while before she could speak again. "... Twins?"

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
A few days had passed and we had hoped things would be better for Holly. But, sadly, they weren't. Her shrinking just became more and more rapid. It had gotten to the point where her family had to take her to a lab to monitor her. They said they would bring her back when she officially stopped shrinking.

We all waited in the village square, hoping for Holly to be brought back. Hannah was cuddling Fozzie, and Jesse and I were holding onto each other.

The Grays had entered, with two people who clearly were Holly's parents, Chad and Erin. There were tears in all of their eyes except Mr. Grey, but you can tell he was trying to be strong.

Jesse, Taylor, Tommy, Dave, Grace, Quinn, Hannah, and even Fozzie, and I were waiting in anticipation, as the four large adults walked in with tears in their eyes, holding a petri dish.

"How small is she?" I said softly.

Mr. Gray looked at the petri dish in hand. "She's 1/12th of an inch tall."

There were gasps from all of us. I wanted to cry, thinking about how that poor girl must feel.

"I need you all to take good care of our little girl." Erin said, crying. Her husband tried to comfort her.

"We will" Jesse said.

Mr. Grey placed the petri dish onto the village grass. Jesse and I slowly walked over to it, and saw Holly completely naked in the fetal position. I very gently reached down to pick her up. I cradled her in my palm, like a small hamster. It was so strange to think that I was holding her in my hand at the same range that people for months have been holding me. If I was normal sized, she would be six inches tall.

Holly tried to look up at me and Jesse, afraid that we were now giants to her. She wanted to cry, but it was clear that the tiny naked girl had no more tears to shed. She stood up in my hand and tried to yell for her parents.

"Mom! Dad! Where are you? Please don't leave me!" Her parents couldn't even hear her at the distance. As Holly could peek over the horizon, all she could see was the fabric of her mother's dress and the denim of her father's jeans. Her parents were now strangers to her, like distant mountains. Chad ushered Erin out knowing that the sooner they left Holly, the better it would be for them all.

"I'm... I'm so sorry, Holly." Mr. Grey said, before he and his wife also left.

All of us were silent. The tiny teenage girl just stood there, naked, looking on at the horizon in my hand. I thought that we all had it rough, but she had it the worst. All I knew was that it was going to take all of us to help this girl live a happy life.

"Holly,... " I said, bringing her closer to my face. "I know that there's nothing I can say to make this better. But we all love you, and we're going to make sure that you have a home."

Holly looked up at me, with her sad eyes. She wiped her face, and even gave me and Jesse a smile. "You guys really care about me?" the tiniest girl said.

"Of course we do," said Jesse. "

Holly looked up and around, at all of the people gathered around her. This shrunken community looked at the tiny girl in my hand, and knew that she deserved all of their care, and Holly felt the love from all of our villagers.

She gave a little smile to us.

"Thank you." she said. I hugged her close to my chest as much as I could without hurting her, and Jesse lightly rubbed my shoulders.

Holly may be tinier than the rest of us, but she is home.

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.title: Poor Poor Holly

1111111111111113111111111211111311111112.content:
It was an exciting time for all of us. Taylor went to her first day at ICE. They had fitted her with a new apron and everything.

She couldn't have been more excited to begin education for her career, even though she was only six inches tall, she felt 50 feet tall.

Taylor's class was very small with only about 9 other chefs in the room. Her teacher, Professor Abigail Lemmon was very enthusiastic and super short at barely five feet tall. "Well everyone, thank you for joining us. I'm so excited to see so many young and enthusiastic future chefs in my class."

Taylor grinned feeling good about herself. Her classmates seemed to mostly take to her as well. One girl named Natalie clearly didn't care for her but she was more passive agressive so that was fine.

"Now, I'm going to put you into pairs and you're going to have to find time after class to work on your recipes."

Everybody got put into pairs, Taylor looked around at her gigantic classmates as they got paired together.

"Taylor, you're going to be with Damien." Taylor looked up and she saw a very handsome black haired boy with freckles and minor stubble.

"Hey Taylor," he said with a casual grin. "Ready to get started."

Taylor looked up smiling.

"Yes, Damien right?" She extended her hand to shake it, and Damien smiling lightly shook it back.

As they cooked in class, they worked on small plates with cheese. Taylor and Damien worked very well together. Damien mostly followed Taylor's lead with him lightly lifting her up so she could get to various objects and pieces of food.

"Wow, it's like I'm living in Ratatouille." She thought. Taylor was standing on the edge of the small pot of melted cheese trying to smell the aromas.
"Definitely needs more Rosemary" as Taylor went to climb down she found herself almost falling off but Damien caught her before she could get hurt.

"You ok, Taylor?" He said.

Taylor stood up in the giant chef's hand, dusting off her apron.

"Yeah I'm fine. Thanks Damien." The two smiled at each other before getting back to work. It was very obvious to Taylor that Damien had a thing for her but she tried to focus only on her cooking. Still, she and the giant couldn't help but smile at each other as they worked on their food together.

His name was Derek Duffman. He was a 26 year old cameraman with a history of marijuana abuse and a lack of following the rules.

“You’re fired!” Mr. Gray told him.

“What do you mean I’m fired?”

“That window you left open in the apartment led to a sparrow flying in and almost destroying the village!”

“Jeez, calm down man. It was a mistake”

“A mistake?! That bird could’ve killed all of those people!”

Derek clearly didn’t feel any sort of remorse. “I don’t know why you’re getting so worked up over this. They’re barely even people anymore, they’re just talking dolls.”

“How dare you!” Mr. Gray was red in the face with fury.

“If anything, you should be thanking me, when that sparrow episode makes it to TV, it’ll probably be one of the highest rated episodes.”

“Get out. NOW!”

Mr. Gray pushed Derek out the door.

Derek was annoyed. He couldn’t believe he got fired for something so stupid, if it weren’t for those stupid shrunken people, he would still have his job.

But then Derek looked in his pocket, and realized he still had the key to the apartment where the village was. He looked at the key and smiled deviously.

“ Time for a little bit of payback.”

As Quinn was tending to Tommy’s wounds, they heard a door squeaking open.

“I thought filming was done for the day?” Tommy said

“I thought so too” Quinn said.

In a few seconds, the sky went dark with cigarette smoke. All of the shrunken people started to gag for air.

“What the hell is this?” Taylor said coughing

“Look!” Someone said

Through the thick smoke, the group looked up and saw Derek the cameraman towering over them.

“What’s up, shrimps?” He said

“Who... who are you?” Grace said

“‘My names Derek, I used to work here, before you little jerks got me fired”

Quinn got heated. “You almost got us all killed! You let Fozzie get hurt, and Tommy’s arm is in a sling.”

With that, Derek reached down and plucked Quinn from the ground. “You wanna say that again, shorty?” Derek said with a sneer.

“Quinn!” Taylor screamed

“You let go of her!” Tommy said

“Mr. Gray!” Taylor cried.

“Let us go!” Tommy begged.

The other citizens screamed in fear as Derek disappeared into the cloud of cigarette smoke. Dave tried to go after them, but it was no use. Even Fozzie barked up at the giant.

With a laugh, Derek dropped Tommy, Taylor, and Quinn into his fanny pack.

“Sit tight” he said to his captives. He zipped up the fanny pack, ignoring their tiny calls for help. Derek quietly exited the building with a grin on his face.

As they swayed uncontrollably in the fanny pack of the giant kidnapper. Quinn, Tommy, and Taylor tried to think of an escape plan.

"What do we do?" Quinn asked.

"I don't know but I'll think of something." Tommy said.

"Well you better think fast, at our size, who knows what this jerk is gonna do?"

Pretty soon, Derek arrived at his buddy Mac's house. Mac is an overweight slob who grows weed in his basement.

"Hey yo, Mac!" Derek yelled. "Remember how I got fired from my camera man gig with the tinies?"

"Yeah what about it?"

Derek smiled and dumped the contents of his fanny pack onto Mac's dirty table. Quinn, Taylor, and Tommy went flying out. Bruising their shins on the way down.

"Are you guys all right?" Tommy asked. Quinn and Taylor nodded in approval but soon the trio were petrified as they saw Mac and Derek smiling at them.

"No freaking way!" Mac said. He picked up Taylor by her leg and dangled her in front of his face. "Ha ha ha, you stole the tinies?"

"Three of em. I figured since they got me fired, I should get to show them who's boss." Derek said.

"Put my sister down!" Tommy said.

"Oh?" Mac said. "This is your sister huh. She's quite the cutie. Ain't she?"

"Personally I like this one more, the wild girl." Derek said grabbing Quinn. "What do you say sweetie? Wanna play house ha ha ha?" Quinn coughed at the smell of his pot breath drenching her face.

"God, it's like a hurricane of weed, gross!" Quinn coughed and gagged.

"Put her down, you jerks!" Tommy screamed from down on the table. Tommy tried to grab a pencil to fight back, but Derek lifted it up, bringing him to his face.

"So Mr. Music boy, if that girl is your sister, is this little doctor girl your girlfriend."

Quinn and Tommy blushed unsure of how to respond.

"Awww look, they're shy, hey Mac, look, they're shy." Derek put Quinn and Tommy in the same hand gripping them together with his fist. "They do make a cute couple I will say." Tommy and Quinn struggled to get out.

Mac was having too much fun making Taylor dance around in his hand moving her arms like a puppet.

"Stop it! I'm not a toy! Stop making me dance!" Taylor protested.

"God this is hilarious. You're so sassy but you're so puny!" Mac said laughing.

"LET US GO!!" Taylor screamed. Mac then teasingly tossed Taylor lightly in the air and caught her in his fist. It seemed hopeless for Tommy, Taylor, and Quinn. They were at the mercy of these giant mad men and they had no idea how to escape their literal clutches.

"What should we do with them now, Derek?" Mac said as Taylor struggled to escape his grungy digits.

What does do the giant kidnappers do with our three heroes?

111111111111111311111112.content:
As I sat there on coffee table looking up at the TV screen, I thought about how different things would be in life. College would be near impossible unless they'd accomodate someone my size.

The TV people were also very nosey and were starting to drive me crazy with all of their questions and asking me to try and do things like brush my teeth with a giant toothbrush or watch me climb the couch. I just wanted for me and my friends to have our normal lives and sizes back.

"Daddy, I just... I just wanna be big again." I felt like crying but my dad came over to me and gently scooped me into his hand.

"It's okay sweetheart, it doesn't matter how small you are, you're still you and you've still got your friends and Jesse fighting with you. And you're strong. You're one of the strongest people I know, and I know my little girl is gonna get through this."

I wiped away my tears.

"Thanks dad." I said sniffling. Suddenly something on the TV caught the eye of me and my Dad.

BREAKING NEWS

A news reporter appeared on screen.

"Good evening, I'm Margaret Ashton and our top story tonight concerns the condition of the six shrunken teenagers famous on their reality TV show. A viral video of a man in Brooksville has surfaced with the person having a special message to the shrunken teenagers.

I watched as the news played a scratchy video clip. An old thin, lanky man with hardly any hair was looking directly into the camera in what looked like a messy shack.

"Hello. My message is to the teens who shrunk. My name is Peter Minker. I'm a Nuclear Physicist, well former, but I've recently come up with a solution to make you bigger, I need you six to come to me. No one else. If anyone besides you six found me, I'd be in danger. Come find me. 928 Holden Street in Brooksville."

The video feed suddenly cut out. I was stunned. I looked up at my Dad and he couldn't believe it either.

"Is... is it possible?" I muttered. I looked up at my dad, who gave me a concerned look.

"Dad, do you think that man can really make us big again?" I stood up with a new excitement and hope that I hadn't had before.

My Dad simply scratched his head.

"Sweetie, that man wanted you and your friends to go by yourselves to visit him. Doesn't that raise any red flags?"

Her dad was right, it did seem sketchy.

"But... but I have to try. If me and my friends can avoid being the size of dolls for the rest of our lives than we should do it."

"I'm sorry young lady, but I'm not going to let you risk your life for some crazy person's false promises.

I was furious. How could my dad not want me to do this? I couldn't look at him, I just sat in a fetal position in his palm. My dad knew I was upset with him, and so he just took me to my room, set me onto my massive pillow and closed the door.

As my father closed the door, all I could think about was the chance that someone out there could really do it. Me, Jesse, Dave, Taylor, Tommy, and Quinn could all be back to our normal sizes. Whether my dad wanted me to or not, I knew that this was a risk that we were all going to have to take.
111111111111111311111112.title: A Shocking Development

1111111111111113111111121.content:
I got on my giant phone and texted the gang to see if we could meet in a special spot. Soon, I asked Allie to give me a ride without telling my dad.


Pretty soon, we were all at our old clubhouse from when we were kids. It looked like a massive labyrinth, but we all sat around an old Monopoly board that we used to play with.

"Do you really think this could work?" Dave asked.

"I don't know." I said "But we've gotta try."

"Are you sure we can't bring anyone?" Taylor asked. "I mean, how else are we gonna get there? Hitchhike?"

Quinn perked up. "Why not? I was born to do this."

"Quinn, with all due respect, not all of us are as keen on traveling in the city on foot while we're all six inches tall." Tommy said.

"Tommy, what choice do we have? Do you wanna be Tom Thumb for the rest of your life?" Taylor said.

"First of all, don't call me that ever again. Second of all, do you even know what could happen if we do this?"

Jesse went over to me and put his hand on my shoulder.

"Staci, do you really think this is a good idea?"

I looked into Jesse's eyes and told him without a word that I was 100% certain.

"Okay, let's do this." Jesse said. "Let's find this guy and get our sizes back."

I got up and spoke my mind. "We're going to find this Minker guy. If anyone wants to stay they can, but me and Jesse are leaving. Who's with us?"

Surprisingly everyone raised their hand fairly quick, even Tommy, who knew this was his chance to be who he really wanted to be.

I smiled, knowing that all of us would be together on this journey. Whether Peter Minker could make us big again was a mystery, but we were gonna find out together. All of us.
